doc.title: Level Zero
doc.plot: A documentary about Alameda County EMS... "Level Zero". With over 110,000 calls for 911 in this system annually, an extremely busy system with a progressive medicine being the role model for many communities throughout the country. With over 1.5 million people living in Alameda, EMS serve and protect the citizens in their most critical hour. These are the faces that will bring you comfort as you dial 911. There is a sense of duty that is only surpassed by the passion to serve. It is because of this that the County of Alameda has become the premiere place for Paramedics and EMT's to hone their skills and gain experience necessary to be successful in EMS. This story will share the real lives of those in service and their impact on the community they serve.
